column1: 430818734530101248;"KomodoWorld#8282";"15-Mar-19 11:34 AM";"this is special address you can create
column2: when you move coins out of it the tx isn't immediate but takes a long time
column4: during that time you can cancel the outgoing tx using another key you setup when creating the vault address

column1: and there's an option for yet another key
column2: that can be used to burn the coins as tx fee

column1: so when creating a vault address you must set the time required to unlock and the recovery key
I'm less sure if the burn key is a good idea
column2: that could be optional";"";"";

column1: 430818734530101248;"KomodoWorld#8282";"15-Mar-19 11:38 AM";"the use case is to have a secure cold storage address
column2: if the key is stolen you have plenty of time to notice and delete the thief action until he gives up (or you go nuclear and burn it all
column3: praying a miner will recover it)";"";"";

column2: mail paper wallet to yourself....
but different";"";"";

column1: 423176312354635779;"gcharang#6833";"15-Mar-19 11:50 AM";"The burn key is like throwing the chess board when there are no options left to recover the funds
column2: I have read that the option just being present will act as a deterrent to any would be hacker attempting to steal the regular priv keys.

column1: But it must be handled with care
column2: or else it becomes a hostage situation if an attacker gets access to the burn key üòÉ

column1: This is something between a hot wallet and cold wallet with optional institutions that can monitor the the address and alert any suspicious activity";"";"";

column2: where the `coinbase` key/value is removed
column3: and instead the coinbase is added in the `transactions` field";"";"";

column1: 232679450301431808;"blackjok3r#3181";"16-Mar-19 06:59 AM";"This allows a pool to directly mine the coinbase created by the daemon.  This is especially useful for things like `ac_notarypay` and `ac_founders` etc... where the coinbase changes on almost every block.";"";"";

232679450301431808;"blackjok3r#3181";"16-Mar-19 07:00 AM";"This means that the pool can no longer take its fee in the coinbase transaction. However I wrote a custom pool that takes its fee in the payment processor instead.";"";"";
